body_html:
Well that's kind of my point. If you're using estimators you have to rebuild it on each call to train, evaluate or predict.

The only way around that is to use a different model abstraction, or roll your own.

For example the Eager examples may provide the flexibility you're looking for.
body_text:
Well that's kind of my point. If you're using estimators you have to rebuild it on each call to train, evaluate or predict.
The only way around that is to use a different model abstraction, or roll your own.
For example the Eager examples may provide the flexibility you're looking for.
body:
Well that's kind of my point. If you're using estimators you have to rebuild it on each call to `train`, `evaluate` or `predict`.

The only way around that is to use a different model abstraction, or roll your own.

For example [the Eager examples](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/eager/python/examples) may provide the flexibility you're looking for.
